verse.text: Paul, an **apostle**—an emissary sent not by any human commission nor through any human agency, but through Jesus Christ and God the Father who raised him from the dead—
and all the brothers who are with me, to the **ekklesias** of Galatia:
**Charis** to you and peace from God our Father and our Lord Jesus Christ,
who gave himself for our sins to rescue us from the present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father,
to whom be the glory into the ages of ages. Amen.
I am stunned that you are so quickly deserting the one who called you by the **charis** of Christ for a different "good news"—
not that there is another one. It is simply that there are some who are throwing you into confusion and wanting to pervert the good news of the Christ.
But even if we, or an **angel** from heaven, should preach to you a "good news" contrary to what we preached to you, let that person be **anathema**.
As we have said before, so now I say again: if anyone is preaching to you a "good news" contrary to what you received, let that person be **anathema**.
Am I now trying to win the approval of humans, or of God? Or am I seeking to be a "people-pleaser"? If I were still trying to please humans, I would not be Christ’s **slave**.
For I want you to know, brothers, that the good news preached by me is not of human origin.
For I did not receive it from any human, nor was I taught it, but it came through an unveiling of Jesus Christ.
For you heard of my former way of life in **Judaism**, how I used to persecute the **ekklesia** of God beyond all measure and was trying to destroy it.
I was advancing in **Judaism** beyond many of my own age among my people, being far more a zealot for the traditions of my ancestors.
But when it pleased the one who set me apart from my mother’s womb and called me through his **charis**
to unveil his Son in me, so that I might preach him as good news among the nations, I did not immediately consult with flesh and blood,
nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were **apostles** before me, but I went away into Arabia, and later returned to Damascus.
Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to get to know Cephas personally, and I stayed with him fifteen days.
But I saw no other **apostle** except James, the brother of the Lord.
Now concerning what I am writing to you—look!—before God, I am not lying.
Then I went into the regions of Syria and Cilicia.
But I remained personally unknown to the **ekklesias** of Judea that are in Christ.
They only kept hearing: “The one who once persecuted us is now preaching the faith he once tried to destroy.”
And they were glorifying God because of me.
Then after fourteen years, I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking Titus along as well.

I went up because of a revelation and presented to them the gospel that I proclaim among the nations. I did this privately before the recognized leaders, to ensure that I was not running, or had not already run, my race in vain.
Yet not even Titus, who was with me, was compelled to be circumcised, even though he was a Greek.
This issue arose because of the smuggled-in false brothers, who slipped in to spy on the freedom we have in Christ Jesus, intending to reduce us to slavery.
We did not yield to them in submission for even a moment, so that the truth of the gospel might remain secure for you.

Now as for those who were recognized as being important—whatever they once were makes no difference to me, for God is not impressed by human status—those recognized leaders added nothing to my message.
On the contrary, they saw that I had been entrusted with the gospel for the uncircumcised, just as Peter had been for the circumcised.
For the one who was at work in Peter for his mission to the circumcised was also at work in me for the nations.

Recognizing the grace given to me, James, Cephas, and John—the ones recognized as pillars—gave Barnabas and me the right hand of partnership. They agreed that we should go to the nations and they to the circumcised.
Their only request was that we should continue to remember the poor, the very thing I was already eager to do.
But when Cephas came to Antioch, I opposed him to his face, because he stood clearly condemned.
For before certain people came from James, he used to eat with the non-Jews; but when they arrived, he began to draw back and separate himself, because he was afraid of the circumcision faction.
The rest of the Jews joined him in this theatrical performance, so that even Barnabas was carried away by their play-acting.

But when I saw that they were not walking a straight path toward the truth of the gospel, I said to Cephas in front of everyone: “If you, though you are a Jew, live like a non-Jew and not like a Jew, how can you force the non-Jews to adopt Jewish customs?”
We are Jews by birth and not “non-Jewish sinners.”

Yet we know that a person is not made just by works of the law but through the faithfulness of Jesus Christ. Even we believed in Christ Jesus so that we might be made just by the faithfulness of Christ and not by works of the law, because by works of the law no human being will be made just.
But if, while seeking to be made just in Christ, we ourselves were found to be sinners, does that make Christ a servant of sin? Absolutely not!
For if I rebuild the very things I tore down, I demonstrate that I am a law-breaker.
For through the law I died to the law, so that I might live to God. I have been crucified with Christ;
and it is no longer I who live, but Christ who lives in me. The life I now live in the flesh, I live by the faithfulness of the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself up for me.
I do not set aside the grace of God; for if justice comes through the law, then Christ died for nothing.
O you senseless Galatians! Who has cast a spell on you? Before your very eyes, Jesus Christ was publicly portrayed as crucified.
This one thing I want to learn from you: Did you receive the *Pneuma* because of works of the law, or because of hearing with faith?
Are you so senseless? Having begun with the *Pneuma*, are you now reaching the finish line by means of the *sarx*?
Did you experience so many things in vain? If indeed it really was in vain.
Does the one who supplies the *Pneuma* to you and works miracles among you do so because of your works of the law, or because you heard with faith?
It is just as it was with Abraham: “He believed God, and it was credited to him as justice.”
Understand then: those who live by faith, these are the sons of Abraham.
And the Scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the nations by faith, announced the good news in advance to Abraham, saying, “In you all the nations shall be blessed.”
So then, those who live by faith are blessed along with Abraham, the man of faith.
For all who rely on works of the law are under a curse; for it is written: “Cursed is everyone who does not abide by all the things written in the scroll of the Law, to do them.”
Now it is clear that no one is made just before God by the law, because “The just one will live by faith.”
But the law is not based on faith; rather, “The one who does these things will live by them.”
Christ bought us out from the curse of the law by becoming a curse for us—for it is written: “Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree”—
so that the blessing of Abraham might come to the nations in Christ Jesus, so that we might receive the promise of the *Pneuma* through faith.
Brothers, I am speaking in human terms: even with a person's ratified covenant, no one sets it aside or adds conditions to it once it is established.
Now the promises were spoken to Abraham and to his seed. It does not say, “And to seeds,” as of many, but as of one: “And to your seed,” who is Christ.
What I am saying is this: the Law, which came four hundred and thirty years later, does not revoke a covenant previously ratified by God, so as to nullify the promise.
For if the inheritance comes from the law, it no longer comes from a promise; but God has freely granted it to Abraham through a promise.
Why then the Law? It was added because of transgressions, until the seed should come to whom the promise had been made. It was delivered through angels by the hand of a mediator.
Now a mediator is not for one party alone, but God is one.
Is the law then against the promises of God? Certainly not! For if a law had been given that was able to give life, then justice would indeed have come from the law.
But the Scripture imprisoned everything under the power of sin, so that the promise, based on the faith of Jesus Christ, might be given to those who believe.
Before this faith came, we were held in custody under the law, imprisoned until the faith that was coming should be revealed.
So the law became our *paidagogos* until Christ, so that we might be justified by faith.
But now that faith has come, we are no longer under a *paidagogos*.
For you are all sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus.
For as many of you as were baptized into Christ have clothed yourselves with Christ.
There is no Jew or Greek, there is no slave or free, there is no male and female; for you are all one in Christ Jesus.
And if you belong to Christ, then you are Abraham’s seed, heirs according to the promise.
Now I say this: for as long as the heir is a minor, he is no different from a slave, even though he is the legal owner of the whole estate.
Instead, he is under the authority of guardians and trustees until the date set in advance by his father.
It was the same with us; when we were minors, we were enslaved under the basic elements of the world-system.
But when the era had reached its completion, God dispatched his Son, born of a woman, born under the jurisdiction of the Law,
so that he might ransom those under the Law, in order that we might receive our full standing as sons.
And because you are sons, God dispatched the Spirit of his Son into our hearts, crying out, “Abba! Father!”
So you are no longer a slave but a son; and if a son, then an heir through God’s action.
Back then, however, because you did not know God, you were enslaved to things that by their very nature are not gods.

But now that you have come to know God—or rather, have been known by God—how can you turn back again to those weak and impoverished basic elements? Do you really wish to be enslaved to them all over again?
You are meticulously observing special days, and months, and seasons, and years!
I am afraid for you—that perhaps I have labored over you for nothing.
I beg of you, brothers: become as I am, because I also became as you are. You did me no wrong.
You know that it was because of a physical illness that I first announced the good news to you.

And even though my physical condition was a trial for you, you did not treat me with contempt or spit me out in disgust. Instead, you welcomed me as a messenger of God, as if I were Christ Jesus himself.
Where is that sense of blessing you had then? For I can testify on your behalf that, if it had been possible, you would have torn out your own eyes and given them to me.
So then, have I become your enemy by telling you the truth?
These people are courting you intensely, but not for any good reason. They want to shut you out from us so that you will court them instead.
Now, it is always good to be courted for a good purpose, and not only when I am present with you.
My children, I am again in the pains of childbirth for you until Christ is fully formed within you!
I wish I could be present with you right now and change my tone, because I am at my wits' end regarding you.
Tell me, you who want to be under the Law, do you not listen to what the Law actually says?
For it is written that Abraham had two sons, one by the slave girl and one by the free woman.
But the son of the slave girl was born according to the flesh, while the son of the free woman was born through the promise.
These things are being spoken allegorically, for these women represent two covenants. One is from Mount Sinai, bearing children for slavery; this is Hagar.
Now Hagar stands for Mount Sinai in Arabia and corresponds to the present Jerusalem, for she is in slavery with her children.
But the Jerusalem above is free, and she is our mother.

For it is written: “Rejoice, O barren woman who does not bear children; break forth and shout, you who are not in labor; for the children of the desolate woman are more numerous than those of the woman who has a husband.”
Now you, brothers, are children of promise just like Isaac.
But just as back then the one born according to the flesh persecuted the one born according to the Spirit, so it is now.
But what does the Scripture say? “Drive out the slave girl and her son, for the son of the slave girl shall never share the inheritance with the son of the free woman.”
Therefore, brothers, we are not children of a slave girl, but of the free woman.
It was for the sake of freedom that Christ set us free. Stand firm, then, and do not be caught again in a yoke of slavery.
Look, I, Paul, tell you that if you let yourselves be circumcised, Christ will be of no benefit to you at all.
I testify again to every man who lets himself be circumcised: he is obligated to perform the entire Law.
You have been severed from Christ, you who are seeking to be made just by the Law; you have fallen away from grace.
For we, through the Spirit and by faith, are eagerly awaiting the hope of justice.
For in Christ Jesus, neither circumcision nor the lack of it has any power; what matters is faith being energized through love.
You were running a great race! Who cut in on you to keep you from being persuaded by the truth?
This kind of persuasion does not come from the one who calls you.
A little leaven leavens the whole batch of dough.
I have confidence in you in the Lord that you will take no other view. But the one who is throwing you into confusion will bear the judgment, whoever he may be.
As for me, brothers, if I am still preaching circumcision, why am I still being persecuted? In that case, the offense of the cross has been abolished.
I wish those who are unsettling you would go all the way and emasculate themselves!
For you were called for freedom, brothers. Only do not use your freedom as a base of operations for the *sarx*, but through love serve one another as slaves.
For the whole Law is fulfilled in a single statement: “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”
But if you bite and devour one another, watch out that you are not consumed by one another.
I say then: walk by the Spirit, and you will certainly not carry out the craving of the *sarx*.
For the *sarx* craves against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the *sarx*. These are opposed to one another, so that you do not do the things you want to do.
But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the Law.
Now the works of the *sarx* are obvious: sexual immorality, impurity, debauchery,
idolatry, sorcery, hostilities, strife, jealousy, outbursts of anger, selfish ambitions, dissensions, factions,
envy, drunkenness, wild parties, and things like these. I am warning you, just as I warned you before, that those who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God.
But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, large-hearted patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,
gentle strength, and self-mastery. Against such things there is no law.
Those who belong to Christ Jesus have crucified the *sarx* with its passions and its cravings.
If we live by the Spirit, let us also keep in step with the Spirit.
Let us not become seekers of hollow honor, provoking one another or envying one another.

Brothers and sisters, even if someone is caught in some false step, you who are led by the Spirit should restore such a person in a spirit of gentle strength. Keep a watchful eye on yourself, so that you are not tempted as well.
Carry one another’s heavy burdens, and in this way you will fulfill the law of the Christ.
For if anyone thinks they are something important when they are nothing, they are merely deluding themselves.
Each person should scrutinize their own work; then they will have a reason to boast in themselves alone and not by comparison to someone else.
For each person will have to carry their own individual load.
The person who is being instructed in the Word should share in all good things with their instructor.
Do not be led astray: God is not to be sneered at. For whatever a person sows, this is what they will also reap.
The one who sows into the soil of their own flesh will reap a harvest of decay from the flesh; but the one who sows into the Spirit will reap a harvest of the life of the Age to come from the Spirit.
Let us not lose heart in doing what is noble, for at the proper time we will reap if we do not give up.
So then, as we have the opportunity, let us work for the good of everyone, and especially for those who belong to the household of the faith.
See with what large letters I am writing to you with my own hand.
It is those who want to put on a performance of outward appearance who are trying to force you to be circumcised. They only do it so they will not be persecuted for the cross of the Christ.
For even those who are circumcised do not keep the Law themselves; they simply want you to be circumcised so they can boast about your flesh.
But may it never be that I should boast in anything except the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world-system has been crucified to me, and I to the world-system.
For neither circumcision nor uncircumcision is anything; what matters is a new act of creation.
And as for all who will align their lives by this standard—peace and mercy be upon them, and upon the Israel of God.
From now on, let no one cause me trouble, for I carry the *stigmata* of Jesus branded on my body.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brothers and sisters. Amen.
